chapter.title: User and Group Functions
chapter.para: This chapter covers the available user and group functions.

section.title: SysGetegid
section.para: Gets the current numerical effective group id.
This function uses the getegid() C API to perform the action.
None
Returns the current numerical effective group id.
section.programlisting:
/* get the current effective group id */
myegid = SysGetegid()

section.title: SysGetgrgid
section.para: Returns information about a group.
This function uses the getgrgid() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para:
An option specifying the information to return. The values are all case insensitive and only the first letter of the option value is checked. Allowed values are:
"NAME"
The group name.
"GROUP"
The numerical group id.
"MEMBERS"
The members of the group are returned in an array.
"PASSWORD"
Always returns a zero-length string.

section.para: Returns information specified by the option.
section.programlisting:
/* the following examples came from a Linux laptop running Fedora */
SysGetpwgid(100, "n") --> users SysGetpwgid(100, "g") --> 100 SysGetpwgid(100, "m") --> an ooRexx array with the member user names SysGetpwgid(100, "p") --> ""

section.title: SysGetpwnam
section.para: Returns information about a user.
This function uses the getpwnam() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para:
An option specifying the information to return. The values are all case insensitive and only the first letter of the option value is checked. Allowed values are:
"NAME"
The user name.
"USER"
The numerical user id.
"GROUP"
The numerical group id of the user.
"REALNAME"
The user's full (real) name.
"DIRECTORY"
The user's home directory.
"SHELL"
The user's default shell.
"PASSWORD"
Always returns a zero-length string.

section.para: Returns information specified by the option.
section.programlisting:
/* the following examples came from a Linux laptop running Fedora */
SysGetpwnam("dashley", "n") --> dashley SysGetpwnam("dashley", "u") --> 500 SysGetpwnam("dashley", "g") --> 500 SysGetpwnam("dashley", "r") --> David Ashley SysGetpwnam("dashley", "d") --> /home/dashley SysGetpwnam("dashley", "s") --> bash SysGetpwnam("dashley", "p") --> ""

section.title: SysSetegid
section.para: Set the numerical effective group id.
This function uses the setegid() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The new numerical effective group id.

section.para: Returns zero on success or -1 on an error.
section.programlisting:
/* set the effective group id to 520 */
call SysSetegid 520

section.title: SysSetgid
section.para: Set the numerical group id.
This function uses the setgid() C API to perform the action.
Returns zero on success or -1 on an error.
section.programlisting:
/* set the group id to 520 */
call SysSetgid 520

section.title: SysSetpgid
section.para: Set a numerical process id to use the specified process group id.
This function uses the setpgid() C API to perform the action.
Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.
section.programlisting:
/* set process group id */
call SysSetpgid 9321, 520

section.title: SysSetpgrp
section.para: Sets the current numerical process usr id to zero and the group id to zero.

None

section.programlisting:
